title: Conor McGregor lays down Frankie Edgar challenge
text:

Conor McGregor has laid down the challenge to Frankie Edgar - and told UFC chief Dana White he'll fight for free in December and give his purse to charity.

McGregor has previously called out former UFC lightweight champion Edgar as he targets a return to the Octagon.

And as Edgar turned 37 on Wednesday, former two-weight champion McGregor tweeted him with a birthday message calling for the bout to happen in two months' time.

Edgar replied by saying he had "said yes already" - referring to comments he made earlier this week that he would fight McGregor "at any weight class".

Irishman McGregor had been tipped to face either Justin Gaethje or Dustin Poirier in his UFC return, having not fought since he was choked out by Khabib Nurmagomedov last October.

(Image: Getty Images)

Edgar had also been mentioned - not least by McGregor's coach at one point - and now it looks like that fight has become a step closer after the pair's Twitter exchange.

McGregor tweeted Edgar and the official UFC account, saying: "Happy birthday Frankie, see you in December."

Edgar replied shortly afterwards with: "Thanks pal, I said yes already it's on you and @danawhite to make it happen."

So McGregor promptly included White in the exchange,saying: "There you go White, make the bout. Give my purse to charity. First responders."

(Image: Getty Images)

Earlier this week, Edgar said he was ready to fight McGregor, a former UFC lightweight and featherweight champion.

“I’ll fight Conor at any weight class. We can do 55, 70, he's gonna be bigger than me regardless of what weight we fight at,” Edgar said in quotes reported by MMA Weekly .

“He’s been saying he wants to fight me. I’m hearing he wants to fight me. And he has the control.

"I don’t know if the UFC is into it, but ultimately I believe Conor has the choice. If he really wants to fight me, we’ll fight.”
description: McGregor wants a match-up with Edgar in December and told UFC chief White he'll give his purse to charity
